newsitem.title: PHILIPPINES: Philippine mills buy 100,000 tns Canadian wheat.
newsitem.headline: Philippine mills buy 100,000 tns Canadian wheat.

text.p: Two Philippine mills bought 100,000 tonnes of Canadian wheat at around $185 per tonne, traders said on Monday.
The commodity will be shipped between May and July this year, one trader said.
"The Philippine order for Canadian western red spring wheat was clinched recently at $10 per tonne cheaper than U.S. prices for the same wheat quality," said another trader.
Philippine mills are shiftinbg back to Canadian wheat suppliers due to prevailing high prices in the United States, traders said.
"It seems Philippine buyers are now confident to buy again Canadian wheat after they were assured of prompt delivery," an executive in a Philippine flour mill told Reuters.
Canadian wheat suppliers had to give "discounts" to Philippine wheat buyers in the past two months due to delayed deliveries.
Port congestion in Canada due to heavy snow early this year delayed shipments of wheat orders for March and April deliveries, traders said.
Philippine buyers of Canadian wheat said they were assured by Canadian suppliers that the congestion in Canadian ports had eased due to better weather conditions.
